adrFormatAddress: 170 8th Ave, New York, NY 10011, USA

editorialSummary.text: Retail showroom for fold-up Murphy beds & wall units, offering custom models & installation.

originalText.text: I had a *fantastic* experience working with MBE. Great communication and service from beginning to end. I love my setup! Looks great and was worth every penny. Duran was my designer and he was excellent. I got the Manhattan (I believe) in white chocolate with custom tweaks. Folds up super easily. Never thought I‚Äôd go gaga over a Murphy bed but such is the case. ‚ù§Ô∏èüõåüò¥

originalText.text: Pleasantly surprised I got same day service call on a Saturday for a unit installed years ago. These people are pros and really do care. Worth every single penny. Thank you Murphy bed express

text.text: Pleasantly surprised I got same day service call on a Saturday for a unit installed years ago. These people are pros and really do care. Worth every single penny. Thank you Murphy bed express

originalText.text: I could not be happier with my decision to work with Murphy Bed Express and I am super picky. They've been in the business for 20 years and it clearly shows given some of the nuances with my asks, which were worth every penny. I have soffits. I had particular design wants, size wants, feature wants. Duran is a master builder and I will certainly be a repeat customer.

originalText.text: Worst business we've ever interacted with, very unprofessional. We had our Murphy bed installed in 2019, but due to multiple circumstances (we did not stay in NYC often), did not really sleep on it often until this year. We noticed that the bed was pulling away from the wall, and began to get nervous about sleeping on it. We called MurphyBedExpress and requested that they send someone to look at it. An installer called us and said he was about to go on vacation but would come when he returned. We were sleeping on the couch and waiting for him to call back. A week later, our cleaning person came to clean the apartment. I sent her a text message saying not to open the bed, but she didn't read it in time. The bed fell from the wall, and she was temporarily trapped underneath it. Luckily, the unit was stabilized by the end of our couch and the weight did not fall on top of her. Hence, she was not injured, just scared. We reported the incident to MurphyBedExpress immediately (called and wrote). They refused all contact and would only say "our insurance adjuster will contact you". The installer was kind enough to text with us but claimed he could not help until we resolved the issue with the company. We contacted our attorney, and unfortunately there was not much we could do legally since nobody was seriously hurt. MurphyBedExpress forced us to sign a letter saying that we would not sue them before they would send an installer to reinstall the unit. This entire process took 2 weeks, during which time the bed remained on our apartment floor. It turns out the installer installed into a brick wall with wood screws and used no other supports. The company has still not apologized to us for this ordeal, and has never discussed it with us over the phone or in person (my husband went to their location on 8th Ave to try to get some assistance). We would give them zero stars, but it seems in order to post we have to give them at least one star.

originalText.text:
This is my murphy bed from them in my new apartment. I moved in 5 months ago and asked about having a new front door to the bed put in. I wanted to upgrade it and possibly have cabinets made too. I keep calling the guy but he keeps gaslighting me about calling me back and he never does.

I'm moving out of here next year and wanted everything done so I could have people over and enjoy my new place. Now I have pieces of Murphy bed sitting in my living room and filling my closet. üò§. Today when I called he hung up on me because he said he was too busy and he still hasn't called back!
